title: Matchsafe, "Advertisement for "Hulbert & Parker, Fashionable Footware"", 1900–10
markings: "The Whitehead & Hoag Co., Newark, N.J." printed on cover (see description.)
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular, curved top and bottom, featuring printed decoration of man's two-tone ankle boot, with lace and hook closures, inscribed on inside of boot "Stacy Adams & Co.", inscribed on boot loop at top of back "Stacy Adams & Co.", c-scroll motifs to upper left and lower right of boot, inscribed below "Hulbert & Parker, Dealers in Fashionable Footwear, 121 Sixth Street, Pittsburg, PA." Reverse features small red griffon holding banner inscribed "None But The Best" on upper left corner, below inscription reads in various typefaces "Stacy Adams & Co., Makers of Fine Shoes, $5.00 & $6.00," in fine print below inscribed "The Whitehead & Hoag Co., Newark, N.J." Both side panels inscribed "None But The Best." Lid hinged on side. Striker on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Advertisement for "Hulbert & Parker, Fashionable Footware"", 1900–10.
1900–10. Plated metal, printed celluloid. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1980-14-785.
